DOC.brief_summary: Late vitreous hemorrhage in postvitrectomized diabetic eyes may be due to fibrovascular tuft formation in sclerotomy sites. Cryotherapy of sclerotomy sites may prevent bleeding by regressing the fibrovascular tuft. This study will detect the safety and efficacy of cryotherapy of sclerotomy sites for prevention of late vitreous hemorrhage in vitrectomized diabetic eyes.
DOC.brief_title: Cryotherapy of Sclerotomy Sites for Prevention of Late Postvitrectomy Diabetic Hemorrhage
DOC.criteria: Diabetic retinopathy cases undergoing vitrectomy History of deep vitrectomy or cataract surgery Renal failure Silicone oil injection during surgery Early rebleeding History of antithrombotic drugs usage
